Not a big deal, but needs to be improved.

review: I've been into digital media for many years and was one of the first roku buyers.  I've recently been switching my rokus out for these fire tvs mainly because I like the interface better.  My Rokus have always ended up having hardware problems like no display, bad remotes, random crashes/reboots, and while the firetv has its own issues, I have not noted the same kind of instability as of yet.CONSAmazon locks out its best interface / UX features so that they are only used by Amazon Video/etc services.  I get it, they sell these to sell more of their digital content, and they, like any greedy company, don't want to empower competing digital content service providers.  If they could only open up their voice API to other apps they would go a long way to being the best media player device.  It'd be nice, too, if digital content you watch on say, netflix, would display on the main menus like amazon content does.  In this respect, the Roku is in a better position, since they are not selling digital content and want to support all content providers equally.  However, Roku's interface/ux designers have a lot to learn from Fire TV.PROSBetter media support, faster, more stable, all the apps you need.  Best UI/UX of all the other options.Google's Chromecast?  PLEASSSSSE its trash.  If money is your issue, go with the amazon stick built to compete with the Chromecast.  Plz google, stick to monopolizing the internet..
